Entities.Name: Bleeding Event
Entities.Definition: Mentions of bleeding, such as hematoma or hemorrhage, or indirect terms like 'bright red blood per rectum'.
Entities.SampleData: hematoma, hemorrhage, bright red blood per rectum

Entities.Name: Bleeding Anatomic Site
Entities.Definition: Location of bleeding, such as 'retroperitoneal', 'epidural', or 'colonic diverticula'.

Entities.Name: Suspected Alternative Cause
Entities.Definition: Non-bleeding causes suspected to result in observed bleeding symptoms. These include trauma, fall, or portal hypertension.

Entities.Name: Severity
Entities.Definition: Describes the clinical seriousness of the bleeding, such as 'mild', 'significant', or 'life threatening'.

Entities.Name: Medication
Entities.Definition: Drugs that can be linked to bleeding, such as anticoagulants or antiplatelets like warfarin, aspirin, or clopidogrel.

Entities.Name: Bleeding Lab Evaluation
Entities.Definition: Lab test results associated with bleeding, such as INR > 3, platelets < 50, or low hemoglobin.

Dataset.Name: Annotated EHR Discharge Summaries (Northwestern University Hospitals)
Dataset.Description: A total of 1,079 de-identified discharge summaries annotated for bleeding-related entities from patients at hospitals affiliated with Northwestern University.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Each EHR was annotated using a BIO tagging scheme for six bleeding-related entities. Annotators used contextual cues (negation, causality) and included multi-word spans when needed. The guidelines emphasized identifying exact mentions within Â±2 lines of known bleeding indicators.
AnnotationGuidelines.Link: No direct link provided. Annotations were done internally under IRB and MOU approvals at University of Massachusetts Medical School and Northwestern University.
